definitions.definition: a hard, strong, gray or bluish-gray alloy of iron with carbon and usually other elements, used extensively as a structural and fabricating material.
used as a symbol or embodiment of strength and firmness.
a rod of roughened steel on which knives are sharpened.
mentally prepare (oneself) to do or face something difficult.
examples: I speak quickly, steeling myself for a mean reply
synonyms: get in the right frame of mind; Morefortify oneself
harden oneself; informalpsych oneself up; literarygird (up) one's loins "the coach gives us tips on how to steel ourselves before a game"
